nettrackercore.shell package#

Submodules#

nettrackercore.shell.helpers module#

class nettrackercore.shell.helpers.Helper[source]#

Bases: object

The Helper class is responsible for adding functions to display the help messages for the available commands in the terminal. Using rich.markdown.Markdown, help messages can be displayed in Markdown format to make them more readable.

static print_dba_help()[source]#

This method displays the DBA help in Markdown format. This help is accessed from the DBA object and shows the possible commands of the object.

static print_main_help()[source]#

This method displays the main help of the program in Markdown format. This help is accessed at the start of the program. This help shows the 3 main commands: scanner to access the scanner, dba to access the database manager, and help to display the help message itself.

static print_scan_help()[source]#

This method displays the scanner help in Markdown format. This help is accessed from the scanner and shows the possible commands. The possible commands are: set to set the value of an option, get to get the values of an option, scan to perform the scan with the assigned options, and help to display the help message.

nettrackercore.shell.shell module#

class nettrackercore.shell.shell.Shell(translator, config)[source]#

Bases: object

The Shell class represents the command terminal where the user interacts with the core of the application. This terminal is inspired by the command terminal offered by Kali Linux Metasploit Framework.

The user can choose several objects offered by the core and must set the necessary parameters to execute the corresponding commands. The terminal design is implemented with rich, a Python package that helps write and display more complex text in the command terminal in a more beautiful way.:

Rich is a Python library for writing rich text (with color and style) to the terminal, and for displaying advanced
content such as tables, markdown, and syntax highlighted code.

Use Rich to make your command line applications visually appealing and present data in a more readable way. Rich can
also be a useful debugging aid by pretty printing and syntax highlighting data structures.

The objects that can be used are a scanner and a database administrator (dba). With the scanner, network or specific device scans can be performed and then stored in the database. The dba object is responsible for querying the database and displaying the results to the user in a comprehensible manner.

LOGO = '[magenta] _  _  ___  _____        _____  ___  ___   ___  _  __ ___  ___ \n| \\| || __||_   _|      |_   _|| _ \\/   \\ / __|| |/ /| __|| _ \\\n| .  || _|   | |          | |  |   /| - || (__ |   < | _| |   /\n|_|\\_||___|  |_|          |_|  |_|_\\|_|_| \\___||_|\\_\\|___||_|_\\\n'#
build_params(options)[source]#

There are certain parameters that correspond to boolean queries and depending on their value, more or fewer values should be added to the final scanner command. These parameters are found within the dictionary with the mapped options.

Parameters:

options (dict) – is the dictionary with the mapped options

Returns:

the final value of the OPTIONS parameter

Return type:

dict

dba()[source]#

This method uses the ~nettrackercore.core.dba.DBA object to query the database and return the result to the user in table form. The commands that need to be issued have their own syntax, as SQL language cannot be used to query the database.

From the shell, we can only perform two actions: get and list. It is only possible to get either all networks from the database or just one network based on its name. Only devices within a network by their name and the services of a device within a network can be listed.

get_options(options, option)[source]#

This method is responsible for obtaining the values of the different options used by the object. These options are mapped in a dictionary to improve access to them. The user can get the value of one option or all mapped options with the ALL option.

Parameters:

  • options – is the dictionary with the different mapped options of the object

  • option – is the option from which the value will be obtained. If ALL or all is specified, the values of all options are returned.

handler(signum=None, frame=None)[source]#

This method is necessary to capture the Ctrl+C keyboard signal

main_menu()[source]#

This method displays the main prompt of the program where the user chooses which object to use.

save_scan(scan_result: JSONResult, options)[source]#

This method is responsible for saving the scan result in the database. Certain parameters correspond to the mapped options of the scanner.

Parameters:

  • scan_result (JSONResult) – the scan result in the form of a JSONResult object

  • options (dict) – are the mapped options of the scanner

scanner()[source]#

The method scanner() establishes the logic of the object. When the user decides to use the scanner, this method is executed. First, a Scanner object is created and then a dictionary with the allowed scanner options is created.

The user enters one of the possible options:

  • exit Exits the terminal

  • help Displays the scanner help

  • set <option> <value> sets the value of a mapped option to the one entered by the user

  • get <option> | ALL returns the value of the option entered by the user. If ALL or all is specified, all values are returned

  • scan Starts scanning the network with the data set by the user and asks the user if they want to store the information in the database.

set_options(options, option, value)[source]#

Method responsible for setting a value to the option passed as a parameter. The different options are previously set in a dictionary.

Parameters:

  • options (dict) – is the dictionary with the different mapped options.

  • option (str) – is the option within the mapped options that is going to be modified.

  • value (str) – is the value that will be set to the option.
